definition: to have a good talk
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan

sentences.english: In today's program, celebrity, Yang Lan talks about rainforest protection with Kathy Yin.
sentences.chinese: 在本期节目中，杨澜与尹畅面对面，倾谈雨林保护。

sentences.english: William: Thanks. But Jean, if you ever want to pour your heart out to me please just go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 你能这么交心交肺的和我倾谈，我已经很感动了。

sentences.english: They always have a cell phone and spend a lot of time talking.
sentences.chinese: 常带着手提电活，花许多时间倾谈。

sentences.english: People prefer to talk to someone who is presentable, meaning clean and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢与注重外型的人倾谈，意思是清洁及整齐。

sentences.english: JingChen see they talk a lot, that is, to separate excuse he love and highlights.
sentences.chinese: 景臣见他们倾谈甚欢，即以借口分开玥爱与拔萃。

sentences.english: People prefer to talk to someone who is presentable, audio technica earphones, meaning clean and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢与注重外型的人倾谈，意思是清洁及整齐。

sentences.english: My foot talks with the stones it treads.
sentences.chinese: 我的足同走过的顽石倾谈。

sentences.english: The scene in the gallery was packed as people surveyed the work and chatted .
sentences.chinese: 到场的嘉宾正在画廊内欣赏展出的作品和互相倾谈。

sentences.english: All my annoyance were poured to friends and we all had a good mood at this moment .
sentences.chinese: 所有的烦恼都一一倾谈与友人，畅拨我们的好心情。

definition: to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
lit. knees pressed close/intimate/seated side by side/in close contact
to chat
to sit side-by-side and have a heart-to-heart talk (idiom)
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to listen attentively
to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
a long talk
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
to have a heart-to-heart chat
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
to chat
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to drink and chat merrily (idiom)
to chat about domestic trivia (idiom)
